title: CN Level 8 — Small Office Network Design
concept: Scenario-based design for a small office: devices, topology, IP addressing.

challenges.title: Q1: Devices & Topology
challenges.description: Design a basic network for an office with 30 computers and Internet access. List the main network devices you would use (router, switches, access points, etc.) and describe a simple topology connecting them.
challenges.outputDescription: Short design with device list and topology explanation (checked manually).
examples: Hint: ISP modem/router → core switch → access switches → PCs and Wi-Fi AP(s).
challenges.starterCode: // Describe devices and how they are connected in a simple diagram (text).

challenges.title: Q2: IP Addressing Plan
challenges.description: For the same office network, propose a simple IPv4 addressing plan using a private subnet (e.g., 192.168.x.x). Explain how devices get their IP addresses (DHCP vs static).
challenges.outputDescription: Subnet choice and explanation of address assignment (checked manually).
challenges.starterCode: // Write your IP scheme and how DHCP would be used.

challenges.title: Q3: Wired vs Wireless
challenges.description: In this office of 30 computers and some mobile devices, explain which devices you would connect via wired Ethernet and which via Wi-Fi, and why.
challenges.outputDescription: Explanation comparing wired and wireless for different device types.
examples: Hint: Desktops and servers often use wired for reliability, laptops/phones often use Wi-Fi for mobility.
challenges.starterCode: // Briefly describe your choice of wired vs wireless for device categories.

challenges.title: Q4: Basic VLAN Idea (Optional Advanced)
challenges.description: Suppose the office has two departments: Admin and Dev. Explain how VLANs could be used to separate their traffic logically even if they share the same physical switches.
challenges.outputDescription: High-level explanation of VLAN tags and isolation.
examples: Hint: VLAN 10 for Admin, VLAN 20 for Dev, router or Layer-3 switch for inter-VLAN routing.
challenges.starterCode: // Explain how VLANs help segment the network and why this is useful.

challenges.title: Q5: Internet Redundancy (Bonus)
challenges.description: If the office requires high availability Internet, briefly describe one way to add redundancy for the WAN connection.
challenges.outputDescription: Description of adding second ISP or backup link and how failover might work.
examples: Example: Use dual WAN router with two ISPs and automatic failover.
challenges.starterCode: // Describe one redundancy option and how it improves reliability.
